title: Calories in 1 Tsp Olive Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in tsp olive oil, including full nutrition breakdown like fat content, plus equivalents and tweaks for cooking.
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil, 1 level teaspoon (≈5 ml), at room temperature; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by olive oil type (extra virgin vs. refined), brand, and measurement accuracy. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of olive oil provides about 40 calories, all from healthy fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Extra virgin vs. light olive oil

faqs.q: How many calories in tsp olive oil?
Is olive oil high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tsp has 4.5 g total fat, mostly monounsaturated.

faqs.q: Does olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, sugars, or protein—pure fat source.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories between olive oil and other oils?
faqs.a: Similar to most oils at ~40 kcal per tsp; varies slightly by type.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in tsp olive oil?
faqs.a: Calories remain the same; heating doesn't change energy content.
